segment.source: An OEMInput file specifies the device platform, the feature manifest files, the release type, device model, build type, languages you want to support, boot UI language, device resolutions, and other attributes like optional features that you want to include as part of your image.
segment.target: An OEMInput file specifies the device platform, the feature manifest files, the release type, device model, build type, languages you want to support, boot UI language, device resolutions, and other attributes like optional features that you want to include as part of your image.

segment.source: Configure the OEMInput file
segment.target: Configure the OEMInput file

segment.source: Configure the OEMInput file
segment.target: Configure the OEMInput file

segment.source: Now that you've configured your customization settings in the MCSF CAF and added custom OEM features in the OEM manifest file, you'll need to create an OEMInput file that specifies the device platform, the feature manifest files, the release type, device model, build type, languages you want to support, boot UI language, device resolutions, and other attributes like optional features that you want to include as part of your image.
segment.target: Now that you've configured your customization settings in the MCSF CAF and added custom OEM features in the OEM manifest file, you'll need to create an OEMInput file that specifies the device platform, the feature manifest files, the release type, device model, build type, languages you want to support, boot UI language, device resolutions, and other attributes like optional features that you want to include as part of your image.

segment.source: For more information about each element in the OEMInput file, see OEMInput file contents.
segment.target: For more information about each element in the OEMInput file, see OEMInput file contents.

segment.source: In this walkthrough, we will add the two features we defined in Adding a package to an OEM manifest file, specifying the languages that we want to support, and defining the rest of our image.
segment.target: In this walkthrough, we will add the two features we defined in Adding a package to an OEM manifest file, specifying the languages that we want to support, and defining the rest of our image.

segment.source: To configure the OEMInput file
segment.target: To configure the OEMInput file

segment.source: Create a new OEMInput.xml file or modify an existing OEMInput file.
segment.target: Create a new OEMInput.xml file or modify an existing OEMInput file.

segment.source: For an example of what the OEMInput.xml file looks like, see %WPDKCONTENTROOT%OEMInputSamplesFake in your kit installation folder.
segment.target: For an example of what the OEMInput.xml file looks like, see %WPDKCONTENTROOT%OEMInputSamplesFake in your kit installation folder.

segment.source: In the following example, we copied the contents of the %WPDKCONTENTROOT%OEMInputSamplesFakeTestOEMInput.xml file and made the following modifications:
segment.target: In the following example, we copied the contents of the %WPDKCONTENTROOT%OEMInputSamplesFakeTestOEMInput.xml file and made the following modifications:

segment.source: Added a new description.
segment.target: Added a new description.

segment.source: Added English (United Kingdom), French (France), Spanish (Spain), and Chinese (Simplified) to the list of included devices languages in addition to English (United States).
segment.target: Added English (United Kingdom), French (France), Spanish (Spain), and Chinese (Simplified) to the list of included devices languages in addition to English (United States).

segment.source: We added this in the UserInterface section.
segment.target: We added this in the UserInterface section.

segment.source: For more information about other languages you can add to your mobile device, including how to change the default device language and regional format, see Mobile device languages.
segment.target: For more information about other languages you can add to your mobile device, including how to change the default device language and regional format, see Mobile device languages.

segment.source: Added the ContosoOptionalFeatures.xml feature manifest file that we created in the Adding a package to an OEM manifest file walkthrough and placed it under the AdditionalFMs section of the OEMInput file by adding a new AdditionalFM entry and specifying the location and name of the feature manifest file.
segment.target: Added the ContosoOptionalFeatures.xml feature manifest file that we created in the Adding a package to an OEM manifest file walkthrough and placed it under the AdditionalFMs section of the OEMInput file by adding a new AdditionalFM entry and specifying the location and name of the feature manifest file.

segment.source: Added the ECHODRIVER and QUICKACTIONS features by adding a new OEM subsection within the Features section of the OEMInput file.
segment.target: Added the ECHODRIVER and QUICKACTIONS features by adding a new OEM subsection within the Features section of the OEMInput file.

segment.source: For each feature that we add within the OEM section, we add a new Feature entry and then specify the name of the feature that we defined in the feature manifest file.
segment.target: For each feature that we add within the OEM section, we add a new Feature entry and then specify the name of the feature that we defined in the feature manifest file.

segment.source: Note If you're using a mobile reference device, make sure you update the values in the SOC, SV, and Device sections of the OEMInput.xml.
segment.target: Note If you're using a mobile reference device, make sure you update the values in the SOC, SV, and Device sections of the OEMInput.xml.

segment.source: You may also change the ReleaseType depending on what you're trying to do.
segment.target: You may also change the ReleaseType depending on what you're trying to do.

segment.source: Make sure you follow the guidance in OEMInput file contents when specifying values for these elements.
segment.target: Make sure you follow the guidance in OEMInput file contents when specifying values for these elements.

segment.source: Name and save your OEMInput.xml file.
segment.target: Name and save your OEMInput.xml file.

segment.source: For our example, we named it ContosoTestOEMInput.xml and saved it in a %WPDKCONTENTROOT%ContosoOEMInput folder.
segment.target: For our example, we named it ContosoTestOEMInput.xml and saved it in a %WPDKCONTENTROOT%ContosoOEMInput folder.
